required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: UNcovering the Difference Between Ranibizumab and Aflibercept, Focusing on Systemic Anti-vascular Endothelial Growth Factor (VEGF) Effects in Patients With neovascuLar Age-related Macular Degeneration (AMD)
clinical_study.official_title: A 3 Months, patient-and Rater Blinded, Randomized, Prospective Study Comparing Systemic Anti-VEGF Effects Between Ranibizumab and Aflibercept in Treatment na√Øve Neovascular Age-related Macular Degeneration (nAMD) Patients

brief_summary.textblock:
This study assessed systemic vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF) level in patients with neovascular Age-related Macular Degeneration following treatment with Ranibizumab or Aflibercept.
Free plasma VEGF-A level was measured in this study .

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline at Month 3 in Plasma VEGF Following Intravitreal (IVT) Injection of Anti-VEGF Agent
primary_outcome.description: Percent change in blood VEGF level is calculated as the difference in blood VEGF level measured after 3 month of anti-VEGF agent IVT treatment (Ranibizumab or Aflibercept) when compared to baseline blood VEGF level.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Plasma VEGF Level Overtime
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline up to month 3
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma VEGF measurement performed at all visits and compared to baseline level

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation Between Percent Change From Baseline Plasma VEGF Level and the Serum Anti-VEGF Agent Overtime
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-dose to post-dose at Baseline, week 1, week 2, month 1, month 2, and month 3
secondary_outcome.description: VEGF level and anti-VEGF concentration measured in the blood at each single visit, including pre- and post-dose measurement at the dosing visits.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Best Corrected Visual Acuity (BCVA) of the Study Eye Over Time
secondary_outcome.description: BCVA score is assessed on study eye based on the number of letters read correctly on the Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS)-like visual acuity charts at a testing distance of 4 meters. An increase in score indicates an improvement in acuity. Change from baseline calculated as observed post-baseline value - baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Central Retinal Thickness (CRT) of the Study Eye Over Time
secondary_outcome.description: CRT in micrometers assessed by Optical Tomography (OCT) at each single study visit. A reduction is thickness indicates an improvement is the lesion area. Change from baseline calculated as observed post-baseline - baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With Ocular and Systemic Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.description: The incidence of reported treatment emergent adverse events (TEAEs) and treatment emergent serious adverse events (TESAE).

arm_group.description: 104 patients with an eligible study eye were randomized to be treated with Ranibizumab IVT. 0.5 mg of commercially available Ranibizumab were used for intravitreal injection adminstered by an unblinded injecting physician. 3 injections were performed (Baseline, Month 1, Month 2).

101 patients with an eligible study eye were randomized to be treated with Aflibercept IVT. 2.0 mg of commercially available Aflibercept were used for intravitreal injection admistered by an unblinded injecting physician. 3 injections were performed (Baseline, Month 1, Month 2).

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria
- Newly diagnosed Age-related Macular Degeneration (AMD)
- No previous treatment received for diagnosed AMD
- Visual Acuity 6/7.5 to 6/96
Key Exclusion Criteria:
- standard exclusion criteria for anti-VEGF treatment
- Visual Acuity <6/96
- nAMD in both eyes, or any condition in other eye which may have required anti- VEGF treatment during study period
- other disease in candidate eye which could have compromised visual acuity or required medical/surgical intervention during study period
- participation to other clinical study with 'not approved' treatment within a year prior to UNRAVEL study participation.

clinical_study.keyword: nAMD, VEGF, VEGF agent, BCVA, CRT, Ranibizumab, Lucentis, Aflibercept, Eylea

participant_flow.recruitment_details: All randomized patients were included in the Full Analysis Set (FAS).

group.title: Ranibizumab
group.description: 104 patients with an eligible study eye were randomized to be treated with Ranibizumab IVT. 0.5 mg of commercially available Ranibizumab were used for intravitreal injection administered by an unblinded injecting physician. 3 injections were performed (Baseline, Month 1, Month 2).

group.title: Aflibercept
group.description: 101 patients with an eligible study eye were randomized to be treated with Aflibercept IVT. 2.0 mg of commercially available Aflibercept were used for intravitreal injection administered by an unblinded injecting physician. 3 injections were performed (Baseline, Month 1, Month 2).

outcome.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Plasma VEGF Level Overtime
outcome.description: Plasma VEGF measurement performed at all visits and compared to baseline level
outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline up to month 3
outcome.population: FAS: The FAS consisted of all randomized patients who received at least one dose of study treatment. FAS was the analysis set. However, patients who were randomized due to erroneous use of the IRT system and who did not receive at least one dose of study treatment were excluded from the FAS.

outcome.title: Number of Patients With Ocular and Systemic Adverse Events

outcome.population: Safety (SAF) analysis set: The SAF analysis set included all patients who received at least one dose of study treatment and had at least one post-baseline safety assessment.

analysis.groups_desc: H0: ŒºR = ŒºA versus HA: ŒºR ‚â† ŒºA
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: H0: There is no difference in the percent change in VEGF level after 3 months for patients with nAMD treated with ranibizumab compared to aflibercept. HA: There is a difference in the percent change in VEGF level after 3 months for patients with nAMD treated with ranibizumab compared to aflibercept.

reported_events.time_frame: Throughout the study period (day 1 to day 85)
reported_events.desc: Safety assessments consisted of collecting all AEs, serious adverse events (SAEs), with their severity and relationship to study drug and ocular injection, and pregnancies.

group.title: Ranibizumab
group.description: 104 patients with an eligible study eye were randomized to be treated with Ranibizumab IVT. 0.5 mg of commercially available Ranibizumab were used for intravitreal injection administered by an unblinded injecting physician. 3 injections were performed (Baseline, Month 1, Month 2).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The terms and conditions of Novartis' agreements with its investigators may vary. However, Novartis does not prohibit any investigators from publishing. Any publications from a single-site are postponed until the publication of the pooled data (ie, data from all sites) in the clinical trial.
